references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: labels
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize objects. Matches selectors.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: pods
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Pod Multiplicity 0..* Pods in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: host
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Host is the fully qualified domain name of a network host, as defined by RFC 3986.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: EnvVar
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: An environment variable to set in a container.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.title: ConfigMap
references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.content: A ConfigMap is an API object used to store non-confidential data in key-value pairs. Pods can consume ConfigMaps as environment variables, command-line arguments, or as configuration files in a volume.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: hostPort
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Number of port to expose on the host.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: value
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Value of the environment variable. Defaults to empty string.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: phase
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The phase of a Pod is a simple, high-level summary of where the Pod is in its lifecycle. The conditions array, the reason and message fields, and the individual container status arrays contain more detail about the pod’s status. Possible values: Pending, Running, Succeeded, Failed, Unknown.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: rules
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type IngressRule Multiplicity 0..* A list of host rules used to configure the Ingress.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Deployment
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A Deployment provides declarative updates for Pods and ReplicaSets. You describe a desired state in a Deployment, and the Deployment Controller changes the actual state to the desired state at a controlled rate.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: jobTemplate
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Job Multiplicity 0..1 Specifies the job that will be created when executing a CronJob.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/in.title: configuration
references/eSubpackages/configuration/in.content: Configuration resources for managing application configuration and sensitive data. ConfigMaps store non-confidential data in key-value pairs. Secrets are similar but intended for confidential data.

references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.title: value
references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The taint value corresponding to the taint key.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/index..title: workloads
references/eSubpackages/workloads/index..content: Workload resources manage Pods. Pods represent a set of running containers in your cluster. Controllers manage the lifecycle and scaling of pods.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: mountPath
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: replicas
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Number of desired pods. Defaults to 1.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.title: data
references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Data contains the secret data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, ‘-’, ‘_’ or ‘.’. The values are base64 encoded.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type LabelSelector Multiplicity 0..1 Label selector for pods. Existing ReplicaSets whose pods are selected by this will be the ones affected by this deployment.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: parameters
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Parameters holds the parameters for the provisioner that should create volumes of this storage class.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: volumeClaimTemplates
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PersistentVolumeClaim Multiplicity 0..* VolumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod.

references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: apiVersion
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object (e.g. apps/v1, v1, batch/v1).

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: nodePort
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 The port on each node on which this service is exposed when type is NodePort or LoadBalancer.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: PodTemplateSpec
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Describes the data a pod should have when created from a template. Used in Deployments, ReplicaSets, Jobs, etc.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: name
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.title: type
references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Used to facilitate programmatic handling of secret data. Common types include Opaque, kubernetes.io/service-account-token, kubernetes.io/tls, etc.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: paths
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type HTTPIngressPath Multiplicity 0..* A collection of paths that map requests to backends.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: name
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The name of this port within the service. This must be a DNS_LABEL.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: serviceName
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Name of the referenced service.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: reclaimPolicy
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 What happens to a persistent volume when released from its claim. Valid values: Retain, Recycle, Delete.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.title: Secret
references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.content: A Secret is an object that contains a small amount of sensitive data such as a password, a token, or a key. Using a Secret means that you don’t need to include confidential data in your application code.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Route service traffic to pods with label keys and values matching this selector.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: backoffLimit
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Specifies the number of retries before marking this job failed. Defaults to 6.

references/eClassifiers/Cluster/index.ht.title: Cluster
references/eClassifiers/Cluster/index.ht.content: A Kubernetes cluster is a set of nodes that run containerized applications. The cluster is the top-level resource containing namespaces, nodes, and cluster-scoped resources. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: replicas
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Number of desired pods. Defaults to 1.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: restartPolicy
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: protocol
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The IP protocol for this port. Supports TCP, UDP, and SCTP. Default is TCP.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: targetPort
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Number of the port to access on the pods targeted by the service.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: strategyType
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Type of deployment strategy. Can be Recreate or RollingUpdate. Default is RollingUpdate.

references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: name
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Name must be unique within a namespace. Is required when creating resources. Name is primarily intended for creation idempotence and configuration definition.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: resources
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type ResourceRequirements Multiplicity 0..1 Resources represents the minimum resources the volume should have (e.g. storage: 8Gi).

references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: kind
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents (e.g. Deployment, Service, Pod).

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.title: nodes
references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.content: Type Node Multiplicity 0..* Worker nodes in this cluster.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: ContainerPort
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Represents a network port in a single container.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Job
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A Job creates one or more Pods and will continue to retry execution of the Pods until a specified number of them successfully terminate.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: containers
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Container Multiplicity 0..* List of containers belonging to the pod.

references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.title: namespaces
references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.content: Type Namespace Multiplicity 0..* Namespaces in this cluster.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: path
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Path is matched against the path of an incoming request (e.g. /testpath).

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: serviceAccountName
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: volumes
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Volume Multiplicity 0..* List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: ports
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type ContainerPort Multiplicity 0..* List of ports to expose from the container.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: CronJob
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A CronJob creates Jobs on a repeating schedule. CronJob is meant for performing regular scheduled actions such as backups, report generation, and so on.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: restartPolicy
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never. Default to Always.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: name
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 This must match the Name of a Volume.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: pathType
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 PathType determines the interpretation of the Path matching. Valid values: Exact, Prefix, ImplementationSpecific.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type LabelSelector Multiplicity 0..1 Selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: capacity
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* A description of the persistent volume’s resources and capacity (e.g. storage: 5Gi).

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: labels
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Labels for pods created from this template.

references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.title: taints
references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.content: Type Taint Multiplicity 0..* Taints applied to the node. Taints allow a node to repel a set of pods.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: ports
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type ServicePort Multiplicity 0..* The list of ports that are exposed by this service.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Volume
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Represents a named volume in a pod that may be accessed by any container in the pod.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: jobs
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Job Multiplicity 0..* Jobs in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: storageClassName
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Name of the StorageClass required by the claim.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: template
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PodTemplateSpec Multiplicity 0..1 Describes the pod that will be created when executing a job.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: name
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Name of the container. Each container in a pod must have a unique name.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Pod
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A Pod is the smallest deployable units of computing that you can create and manage in Kubernetes. A Pod is a group of one or more containers, with shared storage and network resources, and a specification for how to run the containers.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: daemonSets
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type DaemonSet Multiplicity 0..* DaemonSets in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: serviceName
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 ServiceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set.

references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: annotations
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Annotations is an unstructured key-value map stored with a resource that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: protocol
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP. Defaults to TCP.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: schedule
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 The schedule in Cron format (e.g. ‘*/5 * * * *’ for every 5 minutes).

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: template
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PodTemplateSpec Multiplicity 0..1 An object that describes the pod that will be created on each node.

references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.title: data
references/eSubpackages/configuration/re.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Data contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, ‘-’, ‘_’ or ‘.’.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/index..title: Namespace
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/index..content: Namespaces provide a mechanism for isolating groups of resources within a single cluster. Names of resources need to be unique within a namespace, but not across namespaces. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: Ingress
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Ingress exposes HTTP and HTTPS routes from outside the cluster to services within the cluster. Traffic routing is controlled by rules defined on the Ingress resource.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: requests
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Minimum amount of compute resources required (e.g. cpu: 250m, memory: 64Mi).

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: Service
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: A Service is an abstract way to expose an application running on a set of Pods as a network service. With Kubernetes you don’t need to modify your application to use an unfamiliar service discovery mechanism.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: VolumeMount
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Describes a volume mount within a container.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: secrets
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Secret Multiplicity 0..* Secrets in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: accessModes
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..* Access modes the volume can be mounted with. Valid values: ReadWriteOnce, ReadOnlyMany, ReadWriteMany, ReadWriteOncePod.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type LabelSelector Multiplicity 0..1 A label query over pods that are managed by the daemon set.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: ReplicaSet
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A ReplicaSet’s purpose is to maintain a stable set of replica Pods running at any given time. It is often used to guarantee the availability of a specified number of identical Pods.

references/eSubpackages/networking/index.title: networking
references/eSubpackages/networking/index.content: Networking resources for exposing applications. Services provide stable network endpoints for pods, and Ingress manages external HTTP/HTTPS access.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: replicaSets
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type ReplicaSet Multiplicity 0..* ReplicaSets in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type LabelSelector Multiplicity 0..1 A label query over pods that should match the pod count.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: template
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PodTemplateSpec Multiplicity 0..1 Template is the object that describes the pod that will be created.

references/eClassifiers/Taint/index.html.title: Taint
references/eClassifiers/Taint/index.html.content: A taint allows a node to repel a set of pods. Taints and tolerations work together to ensure that pods are not scheduled onto inappropriate nodes. Diagram

references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.title: key
references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 The taint key to be applied to a node.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: configMaps
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type ConfigMap Multiplicity 0..* ConfigMaps in this namespace.

references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.title: podCIDR
references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 PodCIDR represents the pod IP range assigned to the node.

references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ref.title: key
references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ref.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 The key of the pair.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: nodeName
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node.

references/eClassifiers/LabelSelector/re.title: matchLabels
references/eClassifiers/LabelSelector/re.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* A map of key-value pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions whose key field is the key, the operator is In, and the values array contains only the value.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: persistentVolumeClaims
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type PersistentVolumeClaim Multiplicity 0..* PersistentVolumeClaims in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: nodeName
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: statefulSets
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type StatefulSet Multiplicity 0..* StatefulSets in this namespace.

references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.title: storageClasses
references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.content: Type StorageClass Multiplicity 0..* Storage classes available in this cluster.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Container
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A single application container that you want to run within a pod. Each container in a Pod has its own image, ports, environment, and resource requirements.

index.html.title: Risk Model
index.html.content: Ecore model for Kubernetes concepts. Part of the Nasdanika family of models. Intended Use Creating models of Kubernetes solutions (deployments, services, etc.) and then generating Kubernetes manifests from them. Loading information about Kubernetes clusters into a model for subsequent reporting, analysis, and generation of recommendations. Model Structure The model is organized into the following packages: kubernetes (root) — Core concepts: Cluster, Namespace, Node, Resource (abstract base), KeyValuePair, LabelSelector, Taint workloads — Workload resources: Pod, Deployment, ReplicaSet, StatefulSet, DaemonSet, Job, CronJob, Container, PodTemplateSpec, Volume, ContainerPort, EnvVar, VolumeMount, ResourceRequirements networking — Networking resources: Service, ServicePort, Ingress, IngressRule, HTTPIngressPath storage — Storage resources: PersistentVolume, PersistentVolumeClaim, StorageClass configuration — Configuration resources: ConfigMap, Secret Resources Kubernetes Documentation — Concepts Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) Nasdanika Ecore model for Kubernetes concepts. Supports creating models of Kubernetes solutions (deployments, services, etc.) and loading information about Kubernetes clusters for reporting, analysis, and generation of recommendations. Cluster Node nodes Resource Namespace namespaces Taint taints LabelSelector KeyValuePair matchLabels labels annotations Telemetry

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: replicas
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Number of desired pods. Defaults to 1.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: type
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Volume source type (e.g. emptyDir, hostPath, configMap, secret, persistentVolumeClaim, nfs).

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: completions
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Specifies the desired number of successfully finished pods the job should be run with.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: volumeBindingMode
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Indicates how PersistentVolumeClaims should be provisioned and bound. Valid values: Immediate, WaitForFirstConsumer.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: ServicePort
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Represents a port on a Kubernetes Service.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: volumeMounts
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type VolumeMount Multiplicity 0..* Pod volumes to mount into the container’s filesystem.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: serviceAccountName
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod.

references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.title: effect
references/eClassifiers/Taint/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 The effect of the taint on pods that do not tolerate the taint. Valid effects are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule, and NoExecute.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: limits
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Maximum amount of compute resources allowed (e.g. cpu: 500m, memory: 128Mi).

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: PersistentVolume
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: A PersistentVolume (PV) is a piece of storage in the cluster that has been provisioned by an administrator or dynamically provisioned using Storage Classes. It is a resource in the cluster just like a node is a cluster resource.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: containers
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Container Multiplicity 0..* List of containers belonging to the pod.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: provisioner
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Provisioner indicates the type of the provisioner (e.g. kubernetes.io/aws-ebs, kubernetes.io/gce-pd).

references/eClassifiers/Node/index.html.title: Node
references/eClassifiers/Node/index.html.content: A Node is a worker machine in Kubernetes - either a VM or a physical machine, depending on the cluster. Each node contains the services necessary to run Pods and is managed by the control plane. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: ingressClassName
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 IngressClassName is the name of an IngressClass cluster resource. Ingress controller implementations use this field to know whether they should be serving this Ingress resource.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: type
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Type determines how the Service is exposed. Defaults to ClusterIP. Valid options are ExternalName, ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: containerPort
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 1 Number of port to expose on the pod’s IP address.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: IngressRule
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: IngressRule represents the rules mapping the paths under a specified host to the related backend services.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: port
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 1 The port that will be exposed by this service.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: nodeSelector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Selector which must match a node’s labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node.

references/eClassifiers/LabelSelector/in.title: LabelSelector
references/eClassifiers/LabelSelector/in.content: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. Used by controllers and services to select pods. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: readOnly
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EBoolean Multiplicity 0..1 Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: StatefulSet
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: StatefulSet is the workload API object used to manage stateful applications. Manages the deployment and scaling of a set of Pods, and provides guarantees about the ordering and uniqueness of these Pods.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: DaemonSet
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: A DaemonSet ensures that all (or some) Nodes run a copy of a Pod. As nodes are added to the cluster, Pods are added to them. As nodes are removed from the cluster, those Pods are garbage collected.

references/eClassifiers/Resource/index.h.title: Resource
references/eClassifiers/Resource/index.h.content: Base class for all Kubernetes API resources. Corresponds to the common fields in Kubernetes object metadata. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: suspend
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EBoolean Multiplicity 0..1 This flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions, it does not apply to already started executions. Defaults to false.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: template
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PodTemplateSpec Multiplicity 0..1 Template describes the pods that will be created.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: selector
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type LabelSelector Multiplicity 0..1 Selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: args
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..* Arguments to the entrypoint. If not provided, the container image’s CMD is used.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: imagePullPolicy
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: initContainers
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Container Multiplicity 0..* List of initialization containers belonging to the pod. Init containers are executed in order prior to the main containers being started.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: Inheritance
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Supertypes

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: reclaimPolicy
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Dynamically provisioned PersistentVolumes of this storage class are created with this reclaimPolicy. Defaults to Delete.

references/eSubpackages/storage/index.ht.title: storage
references/eSubpackages/storage/index.ht.content: Storage resources for persistent data. Kubernetes supports many types of volumes. PersistentVolumes and PersistentVolumeClaims provide an API for users and administrators that abstracts details of how storage is provided from how it is consumed.

references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.title: persistentVolumes
references/eClassifiers/Cluster/referenc.content: Type PersistentVolume Multiplicity 0..* Cluster-scoped persistent volumes.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: services
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Service Multiplicity 0..* Services in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: externalName
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The external reference that discovery mechanisms will return as an alias for this service (e.g. a DNS CNAME record). Only applies to ExternalName type.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: ingresses
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Ingress Multiplicity 0..* Ingress resources in this namespace.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: annotations
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type KeyValuePair Multiplicity 0..* Annotations for pods created from this template.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: cronJobs
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type CronJob Multiplicity 0..* CronJobs in this namespace.

references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.title: unschedulable
references/eClassifiers/Node/references/.content: Type EBoolean Multiplicity 0..1 Unschedulable controls node schedulability of new pods. By default, node is schedulable.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: name
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Name of the environment variable.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: env
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EnvVar Multiplicity 0..* List of environment variables to set in the container.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: resources
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type ResourceRequirements Multiplicity 0..1 Compute resource requirements for this container.

references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ref.title: value
references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ref.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The value of the pair.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: StorageClass
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: A StorageClass provides a way for administrators to describe the ‘classes’ of storage they offer. Different classes might map to quality-of-service levels, or to backup policies, or to arbitrary policies determined by the cluster administrators.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: accessModes
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..* The desired access modes the volume should have (e.g. ReadWriteOnce).

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: servicePort
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 1 Port of the referenced service.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: command
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..* Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. If not provided, the container image’s ENTRYPOINT is used.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: ResourceRequirements
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Describes the compute resource requirements for a container, including CPU and memory limits and requests.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: initContainers
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Container Multiplicity 0..* List of initialization containers belonging to the pod.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: clusterIP
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 ClusterIP is the IP address of the service. It is usually assigned randomly. Set to ‘None’ for headless services.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: PersistentVolumeClaim
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: A PersistentVolumeClaim (PVC) is a request for storage by a user. It is similar to a Pod. Pods consume node resources and PVCs consume PV resources. Claims can request specific size and access modes.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: subPath
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Path within the volume from which the container’s volume should be mounted. Defaults to the volume’s root.

references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.title: storageClassName
references/eSubpackages/storage/referenc.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Name of StorageClass to which this persistent volume belongs.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: volumes
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type Volume Multiplicity 0..* List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: parallelism
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EInt Multiplicity 0..1 Specifies the maximum desired number of pods the job should run at any given time.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: image
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Container image name (e.g. nginx:1.14.2, registry.example.com/my-app:latest).

references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ind.title: KeyValuePair
references/eClassifiers/KeyValuePair/ind.content: A generic key-value pair used for labels, annotations, selectors, environment variables, and data maps. Diagram

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: name
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type EString Multiplicity 1 Volume’s name. Must be a DNS_LABEL and unique within the pod.

references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.title: HTTPIngressPath
references/eSubpackages/networking/refer.content: Associates a path with a backend. Incoming URLs matching the path are forwarded to the backend.

references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.title: namespace
references/eClassifiers/Resource/referen.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Namespace defines the space within which each name must be unique.

references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.title: template
references/eSubpackages/workloads/refere.content: Type PodTemplateSpec Multiplicity 0..1 Template is the object that describes the pod that will be created.

references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.title: deployments
references/eClassifiers/Namespace/refere.content: Type Deployment Multiplicity 0..* Deployments in this namespace.
